alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 10:50AM EST until January 04 at 2:12AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River near Ravenna affecting Estill County. Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 23.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The river crested (peaked) at 23.4 feet around 9:45 AM EST this morning. - Forecast...The river will continue to fall slowly and is forecasted to drop below flood stage Monday evening. The river will then fall to 13.6 feet by Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.4 feet on 02/26/1972. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The next statement will be issued 8 PM EST.
